body_html:
Thanks a lot @saeed68gm , I'm trying to run ENet on Android. What was the other op you had to add?
To get the mobile working version of this workaround should do as following or am I missing something?

  1. Apply the changes to my local tensorflow source code
  2. Compile libtensorflow_inference.so with Bazel with the updated tensorflow local source code
  3. Remaining usual steps
body_text:
Thanks a lot @saeed68gm , I'm trying to run ENet on Android. What was the other op you had to add?
To get the mobile working version of this workaround should do as following or am I missing something?

Apply the changes to my local tensorflow source code
Compile libtensorflow_inference.so with Bazel with the updated tensorflow local source code
Remaining usual steps
body:
Thanks a lot @saeed68gm , I'm trying to run [ENet](https://github.com/kwotsin/TensorFlow-ENet) on Android. What was the other op you had to add?
To get the mobile working version of this workaround should do as following or am I missing something?

1. [Apply](https://www.tensorflow.org/extend/adding_an_op) the changes to my local tensorflow source code
2. [Compile](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/android) libtensorflow_inference.so with Bazel with the updated tensorflow local source code
3. Remaining usual steps
